00046 class FdoICommand;

00048 /// \brief
00049 /// The FdoIConnection interface enables a feature provider to implement a
00050 /// connection class, which represents a unique session with a data
00051 /// store.
00052 class FdoIConnection : public GisIDisposable
00053 {
00054 public:
00055     /// \brief
00056     /// Gets an FdoIConnectionCapabilities interface describing the capabilities
00057     /// of the connection.
00058     /// 
00059     /// \return
00060     /// Returns the connection capabilities
00061     /// 
00062     FDO_API virtual FdoIConnectionCapabilities* GetConnectionCapabilities() = 0;
00063 
00064     /// \brief
00065     /// Gets an FdoISchemaCapabilities interface describing the provider's support for the feature schema.
00066     /// 
00067     /// \return
00068     /// Returns schema capabilities
00069     /// 
00070     FDO_API virtual FdoISchemaCapabilities* GetSchemaCapabilities() = 0;
00071 
00072     /// \brief
00073     /// Gets an FdoICommandCapabilities interface describing the commands a provider supports.
00074     /// 
00075     /// \return
00076     /// Returns the command capabilities
00077     /// 
00078     FDO_API virtual FdoICommandCapabilities* GetCommandCapabilities() = 0;
00079 
00080     /// \brief
00081     /// Gets an FdoIFilterCapabilities interface describing the provider's support for filters.
00082     /// 
00083     /// \return
00084     /// Returns the filter capabilities
00085     /// 
00086     FDO_API virtual FdoIFilterCapabilities* GetFilterCapabilities() = 0;
00087 
00088     /// \brief
00089     /// Gets an FdoIExpressionCapabilities interface describing the provider's support for expressions.
00090     /// 
00091     /// \return
00092     /// Returns the expression capabilities
00093     /// 
00094     FDO_API virtual FdoIExpressionCapabilities* GetExpressionCapabilities() = 0;
00095 
00096     /// \brief
00097     /// Gets an FdoIRasterCapabilities interface describing the provider's support for raster images.
00098     /// 
00099     /// \return
00100     /// Returns the raster capabilities
00101     /// 
00102     FDO_API virtual FdoIRasterCapabilities* GetRasterCapabilities() = 0;
00103 
00104     /// \brief
00105     /// Gets an FdoITopologyCapabilities interface describing the provider's support for topology.
00106     /// 
00107     /// \return
00108     /// Returns the topology capabilities
00109     /// 
00110     FDO_API virtual FdoITopologyCapabilities* GetTopologyCapabilities() = 0;
00111 
00112     /// \brief
00113     /// Gets an FdoIGeometryCapabilities interface describing the provider's support for geometry.
00114     /// 
00115     /// \return
00116     /// Returns the geometry capabilities
00117     /// 
00118     FDO_API virtual FdoIGeometryCapabilities* GetGeometryCapabilities() = 0;
00119 
00120     /// \brief
00121     /// Gets the connection string used to open a DataStore.
00122     /// 
00123     /// \return
00124     /// Returns the connection string
00125     /// 
00126     FDO_API virtual GisString* GetConnectionString() = 0;
00127 
00128     /// \brief
00129     /// Sets the connection string used to open a DataStore. SetConnectionString can only be set while the
00130     /// connection is closed.
00131     /// 
00132     /// \param value 
00133     /// Input the connection string
00134     /// 
00135     /// \return
00136     /// Returns nothing
00137     /// 
00138     FDO_API virtual void SetConnectionString(GisString* value) = 0;
00139 
00140     /// \brief
00141     /// Gets an FdoIConnectionInfo interface that can be used to interrogate and set connection properties.
00142     /// 
00143     /// \return
00144     /// Returns the connection info
00145     /// 
00146     FDO_API virtual FdoIConnectionInfo* GetConnectionInfo() = 0;
00147 
00148     /// \brief
00149     /// Gets the current state of the connection.
00150     /// 
00151     /// \return
00152     /// Returns the current state of the connection
00153     /// 
00154     FDO_API virtual FdoConnectionState GetConnectionState() = 0;
00155 
00156     /// \brief
00157     /// Gets the number of milliseconds to wait while trying to establish a
00158     /// connection before terminating the attempt and generating an error. If
00159     /// the provider does not support the timeout capability 0 will be returned
00160     /// 
00161     /// \return
00162     /// Returns the time to wait (in milliseconds)
00163     /// 
00164     FDO_API virtual GisInt32 GetConnectionTimeout() = 0;
00165 
00166     /// \brief
00167     /// Sets the number of milliseconds to wait while trying to establish a
00168     /// connection before terminating the attempt and generating an error. If
00169     /// the provider does not support the timeout capability then attempting to
00170     /// set a timeout will result in an exception
00171     /// 
00172     /// \param value 
00173     /// Input the time to wait (in milliseconds)
00174     /// 
00175     /// \return
00176     /// Returns nothing
00177     /// 
00178     FDO_API virtual void SetConnectionTimeout(GisInt32 value) = 0;
00179 
00180     /// \brief
00181     /// Opens a feature connection with the settings specified by the
00182     /// ConnectionString attribute of the provider-specific feature connection
00183     /// object.
00184     /// 
00185     /// \return
00186     /// Returns nothing
00187     /// 
00188     FDO_API virtual FdoConnectionState Open() = 0;
00189 
00190     /// \brief
00191     /// Closes the connection to the DataStore
00192     /// 
00193     /// \return
00194     /// Returns nothing
00195     /// 
00196     FDO_API virtual void Close() = 0;
00197 
00198     /// \brief
00199     /// Begins a transaction and returns an object that realizes
00200     /// FdoITransaction.
00201     /// 
00202     /// \return
00203     /// Returns the transaction
00204     /// 
00205     FDO_API virtual FdoITransaction* BeginTransaction() = 0;
00206 
00207     /// \brief
00208     /// Creates and returns the specified type of command object associated with
00209     /// the connection.
00210     /// 
00211     /// \param commandType 
00212     /// Input the command type to be created
00213     /// 
00214     /// \return
00215     /// Returns the command
00216     /// 
00217     FDO_API virtual FdoICommand* CreateCommand(GisInt32 commandType) = 0;
00218 
00219     /// \brief
00220     /// Factory function that creates an empty Schema Override set specific
00221     /// to this FDO Provider.
00222     /// 
00223     /// \return
00224     /// Returns FdoPhysicalSchemaMapping
00225     /// 
00226     FDO_API virtual FdoPhysicalSchemaMapping* CreateSchemaMapping() = 0;
00227 
00228     /// \brief
00229     /// Sets the XML configuration stream used to configure the Data Store. 
00230     /// SetConfiguration can only be called while the connection is closed.
00231     /// 
00232     /// \param configStream 
00233     /// Input the XML configuration stream
00234     /// 
00235     /// \return
00236     /// Returns nothing
00237     /// 
00238     FDO_API virtual void SetConfiguration(GisIoStream* configStream) = 0;
00239 };
00240 #endif
